fieldData.title: Social Protection Acts I and II
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Ensuring business continuity and support for essential services
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Against the background of the COVID-19 outbreak, the Federal Government has issued two so-called Social Protection Acts in spring and summer 2020. The first Social Protection Act came into effect on 27 March 2020, the second act took effect on 28 May 2020. Both acts provide the legal basis for many German measures already included in this database. Single measures included in these two packages run different timelines, therefore an end-date was not included in this entry. However, all measures are meant to be temporary to deal with the negative impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The Social Protection Act I and II serve as a legal umbrella for many measures that are already included in the COVID-19 EU policy watch database. The Social Protection Act I lays the basis for the following changes:*easier access to short-time work. See [here]( https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/DE-2020-10_541.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19)*easier access to the basic income support scheme. See [here]( https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/DE-2020-13_404.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19)*easier access to the parental allowance. See [here]( https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/DE-2020-10_869.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19)*longer working period for seasonal worker and marginal employees*continued support for care providers*improved rules for working after entering retirementThe Social Protection Act II followed in May 2020 and added some needed changes, such as:*improved conditions for the short-time working scheme*longer periods for receiving the unemployment benefit I*improved rules for the Social Care Provider Act. See [here]( https://static.eurofound.europa.eu/covid19db/cases/DE-2020-13_1262.html?utm_source=externalDashboard&utm_medium=powerbi&utm_campaign=covid-19)
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: See single measure entries for use of measures.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: Though no formal tripartite social dialogue strucutre exits in Germany at the national level, social partners are usually heard on major legislation pieces or other regulations related to social and labour market issues.
